thread.title: Steph's splash party highlights Dubs' rout of Clippers | NBA | Sporting News
thread.title_full: Steph's splash party highlights Dubs' rout of Clippers | NBA | Sporting News

author: Nba Australia
title: Steph's splash party highlights Dubs' rout of Clippers | NBA | Sporting News
text:
January 29, 2017 12:50am EST January 28, 2017 11:11pm EST Curry had 43 and didn't even play in the fourth... NBA Australia 
Published on Jan. 28, 2017 | Updated on Jan. 29, 2017 
Jan. 28, 2017 
When it’s your night, it’s your night. And Stephen Curry had one of those nights in the Warriors’ 144-98 victory over the Clippers at Oracle Arena. 
MORE: Heat grab seventh straight against Pistons, 116-103 
The stage was set for something big – primetime, nationally televised matchup in one of the NBA’s premiere venues – and Curry stepped into the spotlight to say the least. 
And at no time was that more evident than at the end of the first half when Stephen Curry knocked down a 51-footer to beat the buzzer. 
The shot sent Dub Nation into a frenzy, and it turns out Curry was just getting started. Curry shot 9-for-15 from distance, finishing with 43 points despite not playing in the fourth quarter. And oh yeah, he was supposed to be injured, too. Considered questionable with left lateral quad soreness, Curry didn’t show any signs of laboring through any pain. 
Blake Griffin led the Clippers with 20 points and JJ Redick added 13 points for the night. The Clippers have lost four of their last five games, and with Chris Paul still absent things aren't looking up for L.A.
